info.name: DCIM FastAPI Backend
info.description:
Data Center Infrastructure Management (DCIM) API used by the Angular UI.

## Authentication & RBAC
- Obtain access/refresh tokens via `/api/dcim/login` and store them as Postman collection variables.
- Most endpoints require Bearer auth; mutations require editor/admin, and deletes are admin-only.
- `/logout` and `/refresh` automatically invalidate the previous token pair.

## API Highlights
- Listings, details, CRUD, delete, and audit endpoints all share the `entity` selector: `locations`, `buildings`, `wings`, `floors`, `datacenters`, `racks`, `devices`, `device_types`, `asset_owner`, `makes`, `models`, `applications`.
- `column_filters` accept JSON with dot-notation keys (e.g. {"model.name":"PowerEdge R750"}) to filter derived fields after DB aggregation. Encode the JSON via the Params tab or `encodeURIComponent` so braces/quotes survive the query string.
- `/api/dcim/list/export` accepts JSON data from UI and converts it to CSV format. Nested objects are automatically flattened.
- `/health` performs a live database ping plus runtime metadata check; point uptime monitors or frontend readiness guards here.
- Bulk uploads enqueue background jobs and email a detailed per-row report to the logged-in user.

## Foreign Key Strategy
All relationships are referenced by `*_name` fields (case-insensitive lookups) to keep payloads human readable.

item.name: Health Check

request.description: Check if the DCIM FastAPI server is running. Returns API info and documentation links.
Readiness probe that pings the Oracle database and surfaces runtime metadata (`status`, `version`, `environment`, `database`). Returns HTTP 200 when both the API and DB are healthy.

item.description: Health pings for uptime monitors and load balancer checks. `/` returns docs links, `/health` performs deeper diagnostics.

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Authenticate user and get access/refresh tokens.

**Returns:**
- access_token: Short-lived token for API requests
- refresh_token: Long-lived token for refreshing access
- user: User information
- menuList: RBAC-based menu items
Logout and invalidate all tokens for the current user. Returns HTTP 204 on success.

exec: // Use refresh token for this request

request.description:
Refresh access token using refresh token.

**Required:** Bearer token (use refresh_token)

item.description: User authentication endpoints for login, logout, and token refresh

item.name: Listings

query.description: Optional JSON filters (supports dot notation). Example: {"name":"Hyderabad-DC1"}

request.description: List locations with aggregate building counts. Use `column_filters` for derived columns such as {"buildings":5}.
List buildings with rack/device counts and status. Combine `location_name` with `column_filters` such as {"devices":{"$gte":10}} after download.
List racks with utilization metrics (devices, used_space, available_space). Filter by site/building/datacenter or post-filter with `column_filters`.
List datacenters with rack/device totals plus location hierarchy metadata.
List devices with nested make/model/application data. Combine server-side filters with client-side `column_filters` (dot notation supported).
List device types with make info, canonical model height, and device counts.
List makes with aggregated racks/devices/models counts.
List models with make + primary device type linkage and heights.

item.description: List paginated DCIM entities. Supply the `entity` plus optional DB filters, then use `column_filters` (JSON, dot-notation supported) to filter or search derived fields client-side. URL-encode the JSON (Postman Params tab does this automatically) so braces/quotes survive the query string. Responses are cached per user+filters for faster repeat loads. Requires viewer or higher access.

item.name: Exports
item.description: Convert JSON data from UI to CSV downloads using `/api/dcim/list/export`. Accepts JSON array in request body and converts it to CSV format. Nested objects are automatically flattened with underscore separators. Requires viewer access.

request.description:
Convert JSON array to CSV file. Send the data array from UI and optionally specify a custom filename. Nested objects are automatically flattened (e.g., `{"nested": {"value": 123}}` becomes `nested_value` column). Returns CSV file for download.

**Request Body:**
- `data` (required): Array of JSON objects to export
- `filename` (optional): Custom filename for the CSV (defaults to `export_YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS.csv`)

**Example:** Send the entire dataset from your UI listing as JSON, and it will be converted to CSV format.

item.name: Details

request.description: Get location info + buildings list + stats
Get building info + racks list + capacity stats
Get wing info + floors list + stats
Get floor info + datacenters list + stats
Get datacenter info + racks list + stats
Get rack info + devices list + utilization stats
Get full device info with all relationships
Get device type + make + model + device count
Get asset owner + location info
Get make + models + device types + stats
Get model + make + device types
Get application info + asset owner + mapped devices

item.description: Get detailed information about locations, buildings, wings, floors, datacenters, racks, devices, device types, asset owners, makes, models, and applications by name. Requires viewer or higher access level.

item.name: Create (Add)

request.description:
Create a new location.

**Required fields:** `name`, `description`.

Create a new building attached to an existing location.

**Required fields:** `name`, `status`, `location_name`, `description`.

Create a datacenter at the end of the hierarchy.

**Required fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `wing_name`, `floor_name`, `description`.

Create a rack with status and dimensions.

**Required fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `wing_name`, `floor_name`, `datacenter_name`, `status`, `width`, `height`, `description`.

Create a hardware manufacturer entry.

**Required fields:** `name`, `description`.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "PowerEdge R740",
    "make_name": "Dell",
    "devicetype_name": "Dell PowerEdge R740 2U",
    "height": 2,
    "description": "Dell PowerEdge R740 Server"
}

request.description:
Create a model tied to a make + device type.

**Required fields:** `name`, `make_name`, `devicetype_name`, `height`, `description`.

Create a device type.

**Required fields:** `name`, `make_name`, `description`.

Create an asset owner record.

**Required fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `description`.

Create an application mapping.

**Required fields:** `name`, `asset_owner_name`, `description`.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "Server-01",
    "serial_no": "SN-12345",
    "position": 1,
    "face": "front",
    "status": "active",
    "devicetype_name": "Dell PowerEdge R740 2U",
    "location_name": "Hyderabad-DC1",
    "building_name": "Building-A",
    "rack_name": "Rack-A1",
    "datacenter_name": "DC-01",
    "wing_name": "Wing-A",
    "floor_name": "Floor-1",
    "make_name": "Dell",
    "model_name": "PowerEdge R740",
    "ip": "192.168.1.100",
    "po_number": "PO-2024-001",
    "asset_user": "production",
    "asset_owner_name": "IT Department",
    "application_name": "ERP System",
    "warranty_start_date": "2024-01-01",
    "warranty_end_date": "2027-01-01",
    "amc_start_date": "2027-01-02",
    "amc_end_date": "2030-01-01",
    "description": "Production web server"
}

request.description:
Create a device with all mandatory references.

**Required fields:** `name`, `serial_no`, `position`, `face`, `status`, `devicetype_name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `rack_name`, `datacenter_name`, `wing_name`, `floor_name`, `make_name`, `model_name`, `ip`, `po_number`, `asset_user`, `asset_owner_name`, `application_name`, `warranty_start_date`, `warranty_end_date`, `amc_start_date`, `amc_end_date`, `description`.

item.description: Create new DCIM entities. Requires editor or admin role. Each payload is validated by its schema; missing required fields will return HTTP 400/422. Direct adds for `wings` and `floors` are blocked in the API—use the bulk upload endpoints when onboarding those hierarchies (or large batches of datacenters).

item.name: Update

request.description: **Updatable fields:** `name`, `description`. Names are case-insensitive.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `status`, `location_name`, `description`. Use to re-home buildings or flip status.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `wing_name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `wing_name`, `floor_name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `building_name`, `wing_name`, `floor_name`, `datacenter_name`, `status`, `width`, `height`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** Any subset of device attributes (status, position, face, network fields, associations, dates, description).
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `make_name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `make_name`, `devicetype_name`, `height`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `location_name`, `description`.
**Updatable fields:** `name`, `asset_owner_name`, `description`.

item.description: Update any entity by name. Provide the `entity` query param and only the fields you wish to change; the API validates payloads and ignores missing keys. Requires editor or admin role.

item.name: Bulk Upload

query.description: Entity type: devices, racks, entity_wfd, entity_asset_details, entity_devicetypes
If true, continue processing remaining rows on error. If false, stop on first error.

request.description:
Upload a CSV of devices.

**Expected columns:** HostName, Serial No, Asset Status, Building, Location, Wing, Floor, Room/Area, Rack No, Manufacturer, Model ID, Asset Type, IP Address, Asset PO Number, Asset Owner, Asset User, Application Mapped, Warranty Start Date, Warranty End Date, AMC Start Date, AMC End Date, Position, Face, Description

The API validates and enqueues a background job, then emails per-row results (success/error) to the logged-in user.

query.description: Entity type: devices, racks, entity_wfd, entity_asset_details, entity_devicetypes
If true, continue processing remaining rows on error. If false, stop on first error.

request.description:
Upload a CSV of racks.

**Expected columns:** Rack Name, Location Name, Building Name, Wing Name, Floor Name, Datacenter Name, Status, Width, Height, Description

Processing runs in a background job and emails a status report.

query.description: Entity type: devices, racks, entity_wfd, entity_asset_details, entity_devicetypes
If true, continue processing remaining rows on error. If false, stop on first error.

request.description:
Upload a CSV containing wing/floor/datacenter definitions (one row per hierarchy).

**Expected columns:** Location Name, Building Name, Wing Name, Floor Name, Datacenter Name, Description

**Processing order:** Wings  Floors  Datacenters

Ideal for onboarding building layouts at scale.

item.name: Bulk Upload - Asset Details (Asset Owners, Applications)

formdata.description: CSV file with asset owner and application data

query.description: Entity type: devices, racks, entity_wfd, entity_asset_details, entity_devicetypes
If true, continue processing remaining rows on error. If false, stop on first error.

request.description:
Upload a CSV containing asset owner and application mappings.

**Expected columns:** Asset Owner Name, Location Name, Application Name, Asset Owner Description, Application Description

**Processing order:** Asset Owners  Applications

Useful for onboarding ownership and application mapping data.

item.name: Bulk Upload - Device Types (Makes, Device Types, Models)

formdata.description: CSV file with make, device type, and model data

query.description: Entity type: devices, racks, entity_wfd, entity_asset_details, entity_devicetypes
If true, continue processing remaining rows on error. If false, stop on first error.

request.description:
Upload a CSV containing make, device type, and model definitions.

**Expected columns:** Make Name, DeviceType Name, Model Name, Height, Make Description, DeviceType Description, Model Description

**Processing order:** Makes  Device Types  Models

Ideal for onboarding hardware catalog data.

item.description:
Unified CSV bulk upload endpoint supporting multiple entity types via the `entity_type` query parameter.

**Supported entity types:**
- `devices` - Single device entities
- `racks` - Single rack entities
- `entity_wfd` - Wings, Floors, Datacenters (hierarchical)
- `entity_asset_details` - Asset Owners, Applications Mapped
- `entity_devicetypes` - Makes, Device Types, Models

All requests return `job_id` + `report_recipient` immediately (HTTP 202) and continue processing in the background before emailing a detailed report.

item.name: Delete

request.description: Deletes the location and cascades to buildings, racks, and devices beneath it.
Deletes the building and cascades to racks/devices in that building.
Deletes the wing definition. Ensure no dependent floors/datacenters before deleting.
Deletes the floor definition. Ensure no dependent datacenters before deleting.
Deletes the datacenter. Ensure racks/devices are migrated first.
Deletes a rack and releases any tracked capacity.
Deletes a device and frees rack capacity. Logged to the audit trail.
Deletes a device type. Ensure devices/models referencing it are migrated.
Deletes a make. Models/device types referencing it must be deleted first.
Deletes a model entry.
Deletes an asset owner. Applications referencing it must be updated.
Deletes an application mapping by name.

item.description: Delete entities by name. These operations require the admin role and are fully audited; cascading relationships (e.g., deleting a location) will remove dependent objects. Use with caution.

item.name: Summary

request.description: Returns location-level counts for devices, racks, and distinct device types. Requires viewer access.

item.description: Pre-aggregated views that power UI dashboard cards.

item.name: Change Logs (Audit)

query.description: Optional: Filter by specific object name (requires entity type)
Optional: Filter by username who performed the action

request.description: Retrieve paginated audit logs with optional filters for entity, action, object name, username, and date range. Disabled params show available filters—enable as needed.
Fetch a single audit record (including the user who performed the action) by numeric ID.
Resolve an entity name to its internal ID and return the chronological change history for that object. Supports pagination for long histories.

item.description: Audit endpoints that expose the immutable change log generated by CRUD/bulk actions. Every record includes the acting user, action, entity, and message. Requires viewer access.
